remarks: The operator norm is a bound on the growth of a vector under the action of the operator.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Oct-2015.)
statement:
nmofval.1 $e |- N = ( S normOp T ) $.
nmoi.2 $e |- V = ( Base ` S ) $.
nmoi.3 $e |- L = ( norm ` S ) $.
nmoi.4 $e |- M = ( norm ` T ) $.
nmoleub.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` S ) $.
nmoi2 $p |- ( ( ( S e. NrmGrp /\ T e. NrmGrp /\ F e. ( S GrpHom T ) ) /\ ( X e. V /\ X =/= .0. ) ) -> ( ( M ` ( F ` X ) ) / ( L ` X ) ) <_ ( N ` F ) ) $.
